Strings: In your Dialog class, you can override an [color=Gold]OnHash()[/color] method.
It gets triggered when your script encounters a hash tag like [color=Gold]\[#MyTag\][/color].
You can assign a corresponding value as well, and add many to one block as long as they're separated by white space. [color=Gold]\[#MyTag #Another=4\][/color]
In the example [color=Gold]Dialog.cs[/color] we handle an "OptionColumns" tag.
Since our example option box is a GridContainer, you can set the columns using it.
We just set the number of columns to three with [color=Gold]\[#OptionColumns=3\][/color].
Now we just set them to two!
